violations.description: No try-catch block found. Emits 'error' event that crashes process if not handled - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST attach error event handler immediately after creating archiver instance. Without error handler, unhandled 'error' events crash the entire Node.js process. CRITICAL: This is the #1 production bug (70% of codebases). Always add: archive.on('error', (error) => { handle_error(error); })

lines.content: * When streaming archives to HTTP responses, must handle errors on both
* the archive and the response stream to avoid corrupt downloads.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Emits 'warning' event for non-blocking errors (ENOENT, file access failures) - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST attach warning event handler to catch non-blocking errors. Without warning handler, file access errors (ENOENT) go unnoticed, resulting in incomplete archives and silent data loss. CRITICAL: This is production bug #2 (80% of codebases). Always add: archive.on('warning', (err) => { if (err.code !== 'ENOENT') throw err; })

lines.content: * When streaming archives to HTTP responses, must handle errors on both
* the archive and the response stream to avoid corrupt downloads.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Emits 'error' event with Error object - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle compression errors via error event handler. Common causes: out of memory, invalid compression options, stream errors. Error event is emitted during finalize().

lines.content: * When streaming archives to HTTP responses, must handle errors on both
* the archive and the response stream to avoid corrupt downloads.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Process exits silently with code 0 when event loop empties - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST call archive.finalize() after adding all files. Without finalize(), the archive is never completed and the process exits silently with code 0 once the event loop is empty. This is extremely difficult to debug.

lines.content: * When streaming archives to HTTP responses, must handle errors on both
* the archive and the response stream to avoid corrupt downloads.

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Emits 'error' event that crashes process if not handled - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST attach error event handler immediately after creating archiver instance. Without error handler, unhandled 'error' events crash the entire Node.js process. CRITICAL: This is the #1 production bug (70% of codebases). Always add: archive.on('error', (error) => { handle_error(error); })

lines.content: * No error handlers on archive or response stream. Errors will result
* in corrupt downloads or hung connections.
// ❌ No error handlers - corrupt downloads, hung connections

violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST attach error event handler immediately after creating archiver instance. Without error handler, unhandled 'error' events crash the entire Node.js process. CRITICAL: This is the #1 production bug (70% of codebases). Always add: archive.on('error', (error) => { handle_error(error); })

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Emits 'warning' event for non-blocking errors (ENOENT, file access failures) - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST attach warning event handler to catch non-blocking errors. Without warning handler, file access errors (ENOENT) go unnoticed, resulting in incomplete archives and silent data loss. CRITICAL: This is production bug #2 (80% of codebases). Always add: archive.on('warning', (err) => { if (err.code !== 'ENOENT') throw err; })

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Emits 'error' event with Error object - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST handle compression errors via error event handler. Common causes: out of memory, invalid compression options, stream errors. Error event is emitted during finalize().

violations.description: No try-catch block found. Process exits silently with code 0 when event loop empties - this will crash the application.
violations.suggested_fix: Caller MUST call archive.finalize() after adding all files. Without finalize(), the archive is never completed and the process exits silently with code 0 once the event loop is empty. This is extremely difficult to debug.

CRITICAL: This is the #1 production bug (70% of codebases). Always add: archive.on('error', (error) => { handle_error(error); })
